snippet: A government adviser has suggested that manufacturers pay a 1 percent levy on the price of the devices to finance French movies, music and books.
abstract: French government adviser recommends changes to France's cultural exception policy that protects books, music and movies beyond what is accorded ordinary goods;  proposes digital era update that would have manufacturers pay 1 percent tax on price of smartphones and tablet computers to finance creative works.
lead_paragraph: A government adviser has suggested that manufacturers pay a 1 percent levy on the price of the devices to finance French movies, music and books.

headline.main: As Culture Moves Online, France Tries to Follow It With a Tax
